subject: Data
title: Simpson's Paradox: When Data Reverses Itself
description: A fast breakdown of Simpson's Paradox: When Data Reverses Itself for builders.

hook.text: A university admits a higher percentage of women than men in every department â€” yet overall admits more men.

buildup.text: Simpson's Paradox occurs when a trend in subgroups reverses when the groups are combined.

discovery.text: The key: women applied to more competitive departments. Aggregated data hid the true story.

twist.text: This isn't rare. Simpson's Paradox has appeared in medical trials, baseball stats, and legal cases.

climax.text: The paradox teaches us that aggregated data can tell the opposite story from disaggregated data.

punchline.text: Combine data carelessly and it tells you lies.

quiz.question: What is Simpson's Paradox?
options: A trend that reverses when subgroups are combined
